intro: Spermacoce setidens var. linearifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, typical of the Rubiaceae family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland or undergrowth areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
